member.name: M:CSparse.Double.Solver.Arpack.SingularValues(System.Int32,CSparse.Solvers.Spectrum)
member.summary: Compute singular values and the partial singular value decomposition.
member.param: The number of singular values to compute.
The part of the spectrum to compute.
member.returns: The number of converged singular values.

member.name: M:CSparse.Double.Solver.Arpack.SingularValues(System.Int32,System.Boolean,CSparse.Solvers.Spectrum)
member.summary: Compute singular values and the partial singular value decomposition.
member.param: The number of singular values to compute.
Use normal equation to compute (squared) singular values.
The part of the spectrum to compute.
member.returns: The number of converged singular values.
member.remarks:
If is true, the normal equation (A'*A)*v = sigma*v is considered, where A is an m-by-n real matrix. This formulation is appropriate when m >= n. The roles of A and A' must be reversed in the case that m < n.
The eigenvalues returned are the squared singular values of A. If requested, the returned eigenvectors correspond to the right singular vectors, if A = U*S*V'. The left singular vectors can be computed from the equation A*v - sigma*u = 0.
If is false, the symmetric system [0 A; A' 0] is considered (size m + n), where A is an m-by-n real matrix.
This problem can be used to obtain the decomposition A = U*S*V'. The positive eigenvalues of this problem are the singular values of A (the eigenvalues come in pairs, the negative eigenvalues have the same magnitude of the positive ones and can be discarded). The columns of U can be extracted from the first m components of the eigenvectors y, while the columns of V can be extracted from the remaining n components.

member.name: T:CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.CholmodFactor
member.summary: A symbolic and numeric factorization, either simplicial or supernodal.
member.remarks:
There are 8 types of factor objects that cholmod_factor can represent (only 6 are used):
Numeric types (xtype is not CHOLMOD_PATTERN) --------------------------------------------
simplicial LDL': (is_ll FALSE, is_super FALSE). Stored in compressed column form, using the simplicial components above (nzmax, p, i, x, z, nz, next, and prev). The unit diagonal of L is not stored, and D is stored in its place. There are no supernodes.
simplicial LL': (is_ll TRUE, is_super FALSE). Uses the same storage scheme as the simplicial LDL', except that D does not appear. The first entry of each column of L is the diagonal entry of that column of L.
supernodal LDL': (is_ll FALSE, is_super TRUE). Not used. FUTURE WORK: add support for supernodal LDL'
supernodal LL': (is_ll TRUE, is_super TRUE). A supernodal factor, using the supernodal components described above (nsuper, ssize, xsize, maxcsize, maxesize, super, pi, px, s, x, and z).
Symbolic types (xtype is CHOLMOD_PATTERN) -----------------------------------------
simplicial LDL': (is_ll FALSE, is_super FALSE). Nothing is present except Perm and ColCount.
simplicial LL': (is_ll TRUE, is_super FALSE). Identical to the simplicial LDL', except for the is_ll flag.
supernodal LDL': (is_ll FALSE, is_super TRUE). Not used. FUTURE WORK: add support for supernodal LDL'
supernodal LL': (is_ll TRUE, is_super TRUE). A supernodal symbolic factorization. The simplicial symbolic information is present (Perm and ColCount), as is all of the supernodal factorization except for the numerical values (x and z).

member.name: T:CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.Xtype
member.summary: Defines the kind of numerical values used.
member.remarks:
The xtype of all parameters for all CHOLMOD routines must match.
CHOLMOD_PATTERN: x and z are ignored. CHOLMOD_DOUBLE: x is non-null of size nzmax, z is ignored. CHOLMOD_COMPLEX: x is non-null of size 2* nzmax doubles, z is ignored. CHOLMOD_ZOMPLEX: x and z are non-null of size nzmax
In the real case, z is ignored.The kth entry in the matrix is x[k]. There are two methods for the complex case. In the ANSI C99-compatible CHOLMOD_COMPLEX case, the real and imaginary parts of the kth entry are in x[2 /// k] and x[2 /// k + 1], respectively.z is ignored.In the MATLAB-compatible CHOLMOD_ZOMPLEX case, the real and imaginary parts of the kth entry are in x[k] and z[k].
Scalar floating-point values are always passed as double arrays of size 2 (real and imaginary parts). The imaginary part of a scalar is ignored if the routine operates on a real matrix.
These Modules support complex and zomplex matrices, with a few exceptions:
Check all routines Cholesky all routines Core all except cholmod_aat, add, band, copy Demo all routines Partition all routines Supernodal all routines support any real, complex, or zomplex input.
There will never be a supernodal zomplex L; a complex supernodal L is created if A is zomplex.
These Modules do not support complex and zomplex matrices at all:
Modify all routines support real matrices only

member.summary: Matrix is "unsymmetric": use both upper and lower triangular parts (the matrix may actually be symmetric in pattern and value, but both parts are explicitly stored and used). May be square or rectangular.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.Stype.Lower
member.summary: Matrix is square and symmetric, use lower triangular part. Entries in the upper triangular part are ignored.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CuSolverContext`1.#ctor(CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaStream,CSparse.Storage.CompressedColumnStorage{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A value indicating, whether the storage should be transposed.
member.remarks:
Matrix transposition is done on a storage level, meaning, for complex matrices, values will not be conjugated. This is necessary, because CUDA expects CSR storage, while CSparse uses CSC storage.
The value of should be true for all matrix types, except real valued, symmetric matrices.

member.name: T:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult
member.summary: Error codes returned by CUDA driver API calls.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.Success
member.summary: The API call returned with no errors.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MissingConfiguration
member.summary: The device function being invoked (usually via cudaLaunchKernel()) was not previously configured via the cudaConfigureCall() function.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MemoryAllocation
member.summary: The API call failed because it was unable to allocate enough memory to perform the requested operation.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InitializationError
member.summary: The API call failed because the CUDA driver and runtime could not be initialized.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchFailure
member.summary: An exception occurred on the device while executing a kernel.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.PriorLaunchFailure
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that a previous kernel launch failed .

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchTimeout
member.summary: This indicates that the device kernel took too long to execute.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchOutOfResources
member.summary: This indicates that a launch did not occur because it did not have appropriate resources.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidDeviceFunction
member.summary: The requested device function does not exist or is not compiled for the proper device architecture.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidConfiguration
member.summary: This indicates that a kernel launch is requesting resources that can never be satisfied by the current device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidDevice
member.summary: This indicates that the device ordinal supplied by the user does not correspond to a valid CUDA device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidValue
member.summary: This indicates that one or more of the parameters passed to the API call is not within an acceptable range of values.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidPitchValue
member.summary: This indicates that one or more of the pitch-related parameters passed to the API call is not within the acceptable range for pitch.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidSymbol
member.summary: This indicates that the symbol name/identifier passed to the API call is not a valid name or identifier.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MapBufferObjectFailed
member.summary: This indicates that the buffer object could not be mapped.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.UnmapBufferObjectFailed
member.summary: This indicates that the buffer object could not be unmapped.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidHostPointer
member.summary: This indicates that at least one host pointer passed to the API call is not a valid host pointer.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidDevicePointer
member.summary: This indicates that at least one device pointer passed to the API call is not a valid device pointer.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidTexture
member.summary: This indicates that the texture passed to the API call is not a valid texture.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidTextureBinding
member.summary: This indicates that the texture binding is not valid.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidChannelDescriptor
member.summary: This indicates that the channel descriptor passed to the API call is not valid.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidMemcpyDirection
member.summary: This indicates that the direction of the memcpy passed to the API call is not one of the types specified by cudaMemcpyKind.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.AddressOfConstant
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that the user has taken the address of a constant variable, which was forbidden up until the CUDA 3.1 release.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.TextureFetchFailed
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that a texture fetch was not able to be performed. This was previously used for device emulation of texture operations.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.TextureNotBound
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that a texture was not bound for access. This was previously used for device emulation of texture operations.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.SynchronizationError
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that a synchronization operation had failed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidFilterSetting
member.summary: This indicates that a non-float texture was being accessed with linear filtering. This is not supported by CUDA.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidNormSetting
member.summary: This indicates that an attempt was made to read a non-float texture as a normalized float. This is not supported by CUDA.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MixedDeviceExecution
member.summary: DEPRECATED: Mixing of device and device emulation code was not allowed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.CudartUnloading
member.summary: This indicates that a CUDA Runtime API call cannot be executed because it is being called during process shut down, at a point in time after CUDA driver has been unloaded.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.Unknown
member.summary: This indicates that an unknown internal error has occurred.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NotYetImplemented
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicates that the API call is not yet implemented. Production releases of CUDA will never return this error.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MemoryValueTooLarge
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This indicated that an emulated device pointer exceeded the 32-bit address range.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidResourceHandle
member.summary: This indicates that a resource handle passed to the API call was not valid.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NotReady
member.summary: This indicates that asynchronous operations issued previously have not completed yet. This result is not actually an error, but must be indicated differently than cudaSuccess (which indicates completion). Calls that may return this value include cudaEventQuery() and cudaStreamQuery().

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InsufficientDriver
member.summary: This indicates that the installed NVIDIA CUDA driver is older than the CUDA runtime library.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidSurface
member.summary: This indicates that the surface passed to the API call is not a valid surface.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NoDevice
member.summary: This indicates that no CUDA-capable devices were detected by the installed CUDA driver.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ECCUncorrectable
member.summary: This indicates that an uncorrectable ECC error was detected during execution.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.SharedObjectSymbolNotFound
member.summary: This indicates that a link to a shared object failed to resolve.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.SharedObjectInitFailed
member.summary: This indicates that initialization of a shared object failed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.UnsupportedLimit
member.summary: This indicates that the cudaLimit passed to the API call is not supported by the active device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.DuplicateVariableName
member.summary: This indicates that multiple global or constant variables (across separate CUDA source files in the application) share the same string name.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.DuplicateTextureName
member.summary: This indicates that multiple textures (across separate CUDA source files in the application) share the same string name.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.DuplicateSurfaceName
member.summary: This indicates that multiple surfaces (across separate CUDA source files in the application) share the same string name.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.DevicesUnavailable
member.summary: This indicates that all CUDA devices are busy or unavailable at the current time.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidKernelImage
member.summary: This indicates that the device kernel image is invalid.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NoKernelImageForDevice
member.summary: This indicates that there is no kernel image available that is suitable for the device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.IncompatibleDriverContext
member.summary: This indicates that the current context is not compatible with this the CUDA Runtime. This can only occur if you are using CUDA Runtime/Driver interoperability and have created an existing Driver context using the driver API.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.PeerAccessAlreadyEnabled
member.summary: This error indicates that a call to cudaDeviceEnablePeerAccess() is trying to re-enable peer addressing on from a context which has already had peer addressing enabled.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.PeerAccessNotEnabled
member.summary: This error indicates that cudaDeviceDisablePeerAccess() is trying to disable peer addressing which has not been enabled yet via cudaDeviceEnablePeerAccess().

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.DeviceAlreadyInUse
member.summary: This indicates that a call tried to access an exclusive-thread device that is already in use by a different thread.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ProfilerDisabled
member.summary: This indicates profiler is not initialized for this run. This can happen when the application is running with external profiling tools like visual profiler.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ProfilerNotInitialized
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This error return is deprecated as of CUDA 5.0. It is no longer an error to attempt to enable/disable the profiling via cudaProfilerStart or cudaProfilerStop without initialization.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ProfilerAlreadyStarted
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This error return is deprecated as of CUDA 5.0. It is no longer an error to call cudaProfilerStart() when profiling is already enabled.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ProfilerAlreadyStopped
member.summary: DEPRECATED: This error return is deprecated as of CUDA 5.0. It is no longer an error to call cudaProfilerStop() when profiling is already disabled.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.Assert
member.summary: An assert triggered in device code during kernel execution. The device cannot be used again until cudaThreadExit() is called. All existing allocations are invalid and must be reconstructed if the program is to continue using CUDA.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.TooManyPeers
member.summary: This error indicates that the hardware resources required to enable peer access have been exhausted for one or more of the devices passed to cudaEnablePeerAccess().

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.HostMemoryAlreadyRegistered
member.summary: This error indicates that the memory range passed to cudaHostRegister() has already

members.member:
been registered.
This error indicates that the pointer passed to cudaHostUnregister() does not correspond to any currently registered memory region.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.OperatingSystem
member.summary: This error indicates that an OS call failed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.PeerAccessUnsupported
member.summary: This error indicates that P2P access is not supported across the given devices.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchMaxDepthExceeded
member.summary: This error indicates that a device runtime grid launch did not occur because the depth of the child grid would exceed the maximum supported number of nested grid launches.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchFileScopedTex
member.summary: This error indicates that a grid launch did not occur because the kernel uses filescoped textures which are unsupported by the device runtime.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchFileScopedSurf
member.summary: This error indicates that a grid launch did not occur because the kernel uses filescoped surfaces which are unsupported by the device runtime.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.SyncDepthExceeded
member.summary: This error indicates that a call to cudaDeviceSynchronize made from the device runtime failed because the call was made at grid depth greater than than either the default (2 levels of grids) or user specified device limit cudaLimitDevRuntimeSyncDepth.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.LaunchPendingCountExceeded
member.summary: This error indicates that a device runtime grid launch failed because the launch would exceed the limit cudaLimitDevRuntimePendingLaunchCount.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NotPermitted
member.summary: This error indicates the attempted operation is not permitted.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NotSupported
member.summary: This error indicates the attempted operation is not supported on the current system or device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.HardwareStackError
member.summary: Device encountered an error in the call stack during kernel execution, possibly due to stack corruption or exceeding the stack size limit.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.IllegalInstruction
member.summary: The device encountered an illegal instruction during kernel execution.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.MisalignedAddress
member.summary: The device encountered a load or store instruction on a memory address which is not aligned.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidAddressSpace
member.summary: While executing a kernel, the device encountered an instruction which can only operate on memory locations in certain address spaces (global, shared, or local), but was supplied a memory address not belonging to an allowed address space.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidPc
member.summary: The device encountered an invalid program counter.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.IllegalAddress
member.summary: The device encountered a load or store instruction on an invalid memory address.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidPtx
member.summary: A PTX compilation failed. The runtime may fall back to compiling PTX if an application does not contain a suitable binary for the current device.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.InvalidGraphicsContext
member.summary: This indicates an error with the OpenGL or DirectX context.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.NvlinkUncorrectable
member.summary: This indicates that an uncorrectable NVLink error was detected during the execution.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.JitCompilerNotFound
member.summary: This indicates that the PTX JIT compiler library was not found.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.CooperativeLaunchTooLarge
member.summary: This error indicates that the number of blocks launched per grid for a kernel that was launched via either cudaLaunchCooperativeKernel or cudaLaunchCooperativeKernelMultiDevice exceeds the maximum number of blocks.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.StartupFailure
member.summary: This indicates an internal startup failure in the CUDA runtime.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.CudaResult.ApiFailureBase
member.summary: Any unhandled CUDA driver error is added to this value and returned via the runtime. Production releases of CUDA should not return such errors. Deprecated This error return is deprecated as of CUDA 4.1.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.NotInitialized
member.summary: The CUSPARSE library was not initialized.
member.remarks: This is usually caused by the lack of a prior cusparseCreate() call, an error in the CUDA Runtime API called by the CUSPARSE routine, or an error in the hardware setup. To correct: call cusparseCreate() prior to the function call; and check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.AllocFailed
member.summary: Resource allocation failed inside the CUSPARSE library.
member.remarks: This is usually caused by a cudaMalloc() failure. To correct: prior to the function call, deallocate previously allocated memory as much as possible.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.InvalidValue
member.summary: An unsupported value or parameter was passed to the function (a negative vector size, for example).
member.remarks: To correct: ensure that all the parameters being passed have valid values.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.ArchMismatch
member.summary: The function requires a feature absent from the device architecture;
member.remarks: Usually caused by the lack of support for atomic operations or double precision. To correct: compile and run the application on a device with appropriate compute capability, which is 1.1 for 32-bit atomic operations and 1.3 for double precision.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.MappingError
member.summary: An access to GPU memory space failed, which is usually caused by a failure to bind a texture.
member.remarks: To correct: prior to the function call, unbind any previously bound textures.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.ExecutionFailed
member.summary: The GPU program failed to execute.
member.remarks: This is often caused by a launch failure of the kernel on the GPU, which can be caused by multiple reasons. To correct: check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed.

member.name: F:CSparse.Interop.CUDA.SparseStatus.InternalError
member.summary: An internal CUSPARSE operation failed.
member.remarks: This error is usually caused by a cudaMemcpyAsync() failure. To correct: check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed. Also, check that the memory passed as a parameter to the routine is not being deallocated prior to the routine's completion.

member.name: T:CSparse.Interop.Metis.MetisGraph
member.summary: Adjacency structure of the graph.
member.remarks:
The adjacency structure of the graph is stored using the compressed storage format (CSR). The CSR format is a widely used scheme for storing sparse graphs. In this format the adjacency structure of a graph with n vertices and m edges is represented using two arrays xadj and adjncy. The xadj array is of size n + 1 whereas the adjncy array is of size 2m (this is because for each edge between vertices v and u we actually store both (v; u) and (u; v)).
The adjacency structure of the graph is stored as follows. Assuming that vertex numbering starts from 0 (C style), then the adjacency list of vertex i is stored in array adjncy starting at index xadj[i] and ending at (but not including) index xadj[i+1] (i.e., adjncy[xadj[i]] through and including adjncy[xadj[i+1]-1]). That is, for each vertex i, its adjacency list is stored in consecutive locations in the array adjncy, and the array xadj is used to point to where it begins and where it ends.
The weights of the vertices (if any) are stored in an additional array called vwgt. If ncon is the number of weights associated with each vertex, the array vwgt contains n * ncon elements (recall that n is the number of vertices). The weights of the ith vertex are stored in ncon consecutive entries starting at location vwgt[i * ncon]. Note that if each vertex has only a single weight, then vwgt will contain n elements, and vwgt[i] will store the weight of the ith vertex. The vertex-weights must be integers greater or equal to zero. If all the vertices of the graph have the same weight (i.e., the graph is unweighted), then the vwgt can be set to NULL.
The weights of the edges (if any) are stored in an additional array called adjwgt. This array contains 2m elements, and the weight of edge adjncy[j] is stored at location adjwgt[j]. The edge-weights must be integers greater than zero. If all the edges of the graph have the same weight (i.e., the graph is unweighted), then the adjwgt can be set to NULL.

member.name: T:CSparse.Interop.Metis.MetisMesh
member.summary: Mesh adjacency data structure.
member.remarks:
All of the mesh partitioning and mesh conversion routines in METIS take as input the element node array of a mesh. This element node array is stored using a pair of arrays called eptr and eind, which are similar to the xadj and adjncy arrays used for storing the adjacency structure of a graph.
The size of the eptr array is n+1, where n is the number of elements in the mesh. The size of the eind array is of size equal to the sum of the number of nodes in all the elements of the mesh. The list of nodes belonging to the ith element of the mesh are stored in consecutive locations of eind starting at position eptr[i] up to (but not including) position eptr[i+1].
This format makes it easy to specify meshes of any type of elements, including meshes with mixed element types that have different number of nodes per element. The ordering of the nodes in each element is not important.

member.summary: Specifies that the partitioning routines should try to minimize the maximum degree of the subdomain graph, i.e., the graph in which each partition is a node, and edges connect subdomains with a shared interface.

member.summary: Performs the numeric factorization on a QR factorization object, either one constructed by SuiteSparseQR_symbolic, or reusing one from a prior call to SuiteSparseQR_numeric for a matrix A with the same pattern as the first one, but with different numerical values.

member.summary: Free the QR factors computed by SuiteSparseQR_C_factorize
member.returns: returns TRUE (1) if OK, FALSE (0) otherwise

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.SPQR.NativeMethods.SuiteSparseQR_C_solve(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.CholmodCommon@)
member.summary: Solves a linear system using the QR object.
member.returns: return CholmodDense pointer X, or NULL if failure
member.remarks: system SPQR_RX_EQUALS_B (0): X = R\B B is m-by-k and X is n-by-k system SPQR_RETX_EQUALS_B (1): X = E*(R\B) as above, E is a permutation system SPQR_RTX_EQUALS_B (2): X = R'\B B is n-by-k and X is m-by-k system SPQR_RTX_EQUALS_ETB (3): X = R'\(E'*B) as above, E is a permutation

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.SPQR.NativeMethods.SuiteSparseQR_C_qmult(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.CholmodDense@,CSparse.Interop.Cholmod.CholmodCommon@)
member.summary: Applies Q in Householder form (as stored in the QR factorization object returned by SuiteSparseQR_C_factorize) to a dense matrix X.
member.param: cholmod_dense size m-by-n with leading dimension ldx
member.returns: return CholmodDense pointer X, or NULL if failure
member.remarks: method SPQR_QTX (0): Y = Q'*X method SPQR_QX (1): Y = Q*X method SPQR_XQT (2): Y = X*Q' method SPQR_XQ (3): Y = X*Q

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_di_get_lunz(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines the size and number of nonzeros in the LU factors held by the Numeric object.
member.param: The number of nonzeros in L, including the diagonal (which is all one's).
The number of nonzeros in U, including the diagonal.
The number of numerically nonzero values on the diagonal of U.
Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object.
member.remarks:
These are also the sizes of the output arrays required by umfpack_*_get_numeric.
The matrix L is n_row -by- min(n_row,n_col), with lnz nonzeros, including the entries on the unit diagonal of L.
The matrix U is min(n_row,n_col) -by- n_col, with unz nonzeros, including nonzeros on the diagonal of U.
The matrix is singular if nz_diag < min(n_row,n_col). A divide-by-zero will occur if nz_diag < n_row == n_col when solving a sparse system involving the matrix U in umfpack_*_*solve.

member.summary: This routine copies the LU factors and permutation vectors from the Numeric object into user-accessible arrays.
member.param: The permutation vector P is defined as P [k] = i, where the original row i of A is the kth pivot row in PAQ
The permutation vector Q is defined as Q [k] = j, where the original column j of A is the kth pivot column in PAQ.
The diagonal of U is also returned in Dx.
This argument defines how the scale factors Rs are to be interpretted.
The row scale factors are returned in Rs [0..n_row-1].
Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object.

member.summary: Given a sparse matrix A in column-oriented form, and a symbolic analysis computed by umfpack_*_*symbolic, the umfpack_*_numeric routine performs the numerical factorization
member.param: This must be identical to the Ap array passed to umfpack_*_*symbolic.
This must be identical to the Ai array passed to umfpack_*_*symbolic.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_di_qsymbolic(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.IntPtr@,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given the nonzero pattern of a sparse matrix A in column-oriented form, and a sparsity preserving column pre-ordering Q, umfpack_*_qsymbolic performs the symbolic factorization of A*Q.
member.param: The user's fill-reducing initial column pre-ordering.
member.remarks:
This is identical to umfpack_*_symbolic, except that neither COLAMD nor AMD are called and the user input column order Qinit is used instead. Note that in general, the Qinit passed to umfpack_*_qsymbolic can differ from the final Q found in umfpack_*_numeric. The unsymmetric strategy will perform a column etree postordering done in umfpack_*_qsymbolic and sparsity-preserving modifications are made within each frontal matrix during umfpack_*_numeric. The symmetric strategy will preserve Qinit, unless the matrix is structurally singular.
*** WARNING *** A poor choice of Qinit can easily cause umfpack_*_numeric to use a huge amount of memory and do a lot of work. The "default" symbolic analysis method is umfpack_*_symbolic, not this routine. If you use this routine, the performance of UMFPACK is your responsibility; UMFPACK will not try to second-guess a poor choice of Qinit.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_di_scale(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Given LU factors computed by umfpack_*_numeric (PAQ=LU, PRAQ=LU, or P(R\A)Q=LU), and a vector B, this routine computes X = B, X = R*B, or X = R\B, as appropriate. X and B must be vectors equal in length to the number of rows of A.
member.param: Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_di_solve(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given LU factors computed by umfpack_*_numeric (PAQ=LU, PRAQ=LU, or P(R\A)Q=LU) and the right-hand-side, B, solve a linear system for the solution X. Iterative refinement is optionally performed.
member.param: X [n] The solution to the linear system, where n = n_row = n_col is the dimension of the matrices A, L, and U.
Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object
member.remarks:
Only square systems are handled. Singular matrices result in a divide-by-zero for all systems except those involving just the matrix L. Iterative refinement is not performed for singular matrices. In the discussion below, n is equal to n_row and n_col, because only square systems are handled.
The sys paramater defines which system to solve. (') is the linear algebraic transpose (complex conjugate if A is complex), and (.') is the array transpose.
sys value system solved UMFPACK_A Ax=b UMFPACK_At A'x=b UMFPACK_Aat A.'x=b UMFPACK_Pt_L P'Lx=b UMFPACK_L Lx=b UMFPACK_Lt_P L'Px=b UMFPACK_Lat_P L.'Px=b UMFPACK_Lt L'x=b UMFPACK_U_Qt UQ'x=b UMFPACK_U Ux=b UMFPACK_Q_Ut QU'x=b UMFPACK_Q_Uat QU.'x=b UMFPACK_Ut U'x=b UMFPACK_Uat U.'x=b
Iterative refinement can be optionally performed when sys is any of the following:
UMFPACK_A Ax=b UMFPACK_At A'x=b UMFPACK_Aat A.'x=b
For the other values of the sys argument, iterative refinement is not performed (Control [UMFPACK_IRSTEP], Ap, Ai, Ax, and Az are ignored).

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_di_wsolve(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given LU factors computed by umfpack_*_numeric (PAQ=LU) and the right-hand-side, B, solve a linear system for the solution X. Iterative refinement is optionally performed.
member.param: Workspace size c*n, where c is defined below.
member.remarks:
This routine is identical to umfpack_*_solve, except that it does not dynamically allocate any workspace. When you have many linear systems to solve, this routine is faster than umfpack_*_solve, since the workspace (Wi, W) needs to be allocated only once, prior to calling umfpack_*_wsolve. The size of W is given as:
no iter. with iter. refinement refinement real n 5*n complex 4*n 10*n

member.summary: Deallocates the Numeric object and sets the Numeric handle to NULL. This routine is the only valid way of destroying the Numeric object.
member.param: Numeric points to a valid Numeric object, computed by umfpack_*_numeric.

member.summary: Deallocates the Symbolic object and sets the Symbolic handle to NULL. This routine is the only valid way of destroying the Symbolic object.

member.summary: Using the LU factors and the permutation vectors contained in the Numeric object, calculate the determinant of the matrix A.

Contains information about the calculation of the determinant.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_get_lunz(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines the size and number of nonzeros in the LU factors held by the Numeric object.
member.param: The number of nonzeros in L, including the diagonal (which is all one's).
The number of nonzeros in U, including the diagonal.
The number of numerically nonzero values on the diagonal of U.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_get_numeric(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32@,System.Double[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This routine copies the LU factors and permutation vectors from the Numeric object into user-accessible arrays.
member.param: The permutation vector P is defined as P [k] = i, where the original row i of A is the kth pivot row in PAQ
The permutation vector Q is defined as Q [k] = j, where the original column j of A is the kth pivot column in PAQ.
The diagonal of U is also returned in Dx.
This argument defines how the scale factors Rs are to be interpretted.
The row scale factors are returned in Rs [0..n_row-1].
Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_get_symbolic(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Copies the contents of the Symbolic object into simple integer arrays accessible to the user.
member.param: The number of pivots with zero Markowitz cost.
The number of nonzeros in A.
The number of frontal matrices that will be used to factorize the matrix A.
The Symbolic object, which holds the symbolic factorization.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_load_numeric(System.IntPtr@,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a Numeric object from a file created by umfpack_*_save_numeric.
member.param: On output, this variable holds a pointer to the Numeric object (if successful), or NULL if a failure occurred.
A string that contains the filename from which to read the Numeric object.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_load_symbolic(System.IntPtr@,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a Symbolic object from a file created by umfpack_*_save_symbolic.
member.param: On output, this variable holds a pointer to the Symbolic object (if successful), or NULL if a failure occurred.
A string that contains the filename from which to read the Symbolic object.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_numeric(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given a sparse matrix A in column-oriented form, and a symbolic analysis computed by umfpack_*_*symbolic, the umfpack_*_numeric routine performs the numerical factorization
member.param: This must be identical to the Ap array passed to umfpack_*_*symbolic.
This must be identical to the Ai array passed to umfpack_*_*symbolic.
The numerical values of the sparse matrix A.
The Symbolic object, which holds the symbolic factorization computed by umfpack_*_*symbolic.
On output, this variable holds a pointer to the Numeric object (if successful), or NULL if a failure occurred.
If a NULL pointer is passed, then the default control settings are used. Otherwise, the settings are determined from the Control array.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_qsymbolic(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.IntPtr@,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given the nonzero pattern of a sparse matrix A in column-oriented form, and a sparsity preserving column pre-ordering Q, umfpack_*_qsymbolic performs the symbolic factorization of A*Q.
member.param: The user's fill-reducing initial column pre-ordering.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_save_numeric(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a Numeric object to a file, which can later be read by umfpack_*_load_numeric. The Numeric object is not modified.
member.param: Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object
A string that contains the filename to which the Numeric object is written.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_save_symbolic(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a Symbolic object to a file, which can later be read by umfpack_*_load_symbolic. The Symbolic object is not modified.
member.param: Symbolic must point to a valid Symbolic object.
A string that contains the filename to which the Symbolic object is written.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_scale(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Given LU factors computed by umfpack_*_numeric (PAQ=LU, PRAQ=LU, or P(R\A)Q=LU), and a vector B, this routine computes X = B, X = R*B, or X = R\B, as appropriate. X and B must be vectors equal in length to the number of rows of A.
member.param: Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_solve(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given LU factors computed by umfpack_*_numeric (PAQ=LU, PRAQ=LU, or P(R\A)Q=LU) and the right-hand-side, B, solve a linear system for the solution X. Iterative refinement is optionally performed.
member.param: X [n] The solution to the linear system, where n = n_row = n_col is the dimension of the matrices A, L, and U.
Numeric must point to a valid Numeric object

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_symbolic(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr@,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Given nonzero pattern of a sparse matrix A in column-oriented form, umfpack_*_symbolic performs a column pre-ordering to reduce fill-in (using COLAMD, AMD or METIS) and a symbolic factorization.
member.param: Ap is an integer array of size n_col+1.
On output, this variable holds a pointer to the Symbolic object (if successful), or NULL if a failure occurred.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_transpose(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Transposes and optionally permutes a sparse matrix in row or column-form, R = (PAQ)'.
member.param: Ap [n_col+1] The column pointers of the column-oriented form of the matrix A.
If present, these are the numerical values of the sparse matrix A.
The column pointers of the matrix R.
The row indices of the matrix R.
If present, these are the numerical values of the sparse matrix R.
If true, and if Ax and Rx are present, then the linear algebraic transpose is computed (complex conjugate). If false, the array transpose is computed instead.

member.name: M:CSparse.Interop.Umfpack.NativeMethods.umfpack_zi_triplet_to_col(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Converts a sparse matrix from "triplet" form to compressed-column form.
member.param: The number of entries in the triplet form of the matrix.
The row indices of the "triplet" form of a sparse matrix.
The column indices of the "triplet" form of a sparse matrix.
The values of the "triplet" form of a sparse matrix.
Array of size n_col+1. On output, Ap holds the "pointers" for the column form of the sparse matrix A.
Array of size nz. Note that only the first Ap [n_col] entries are used.
Array of size nz. Note that only the first Ap [n_col] entries are used (optional).
Array of size nz. If present, then on output it holds the position of the triplets in the column-form matrix.
